alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:20AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Melbourne FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .As Hurricane Ian moves toward the east central Florida coast early this morning, historic heavy rainfall will continue, leading to quickly rising levels on the Saint Johns River at Deland. Levels will rise to Minor Flood Stage by this afternoon and continue to climb, reaching Major Flood Stage this weekend, cresting at 5.8 which is just below Record Flood. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts in the next 24 hours. Due to wind effects and drainage from upstream, the river is forecast to remain in Major Flood into early next week. For the St. Johns River...including Deland...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Deland. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.3 feet, Major flooding occurs to many structures and marinas along the river and in the Hontoon Island area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 3.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to 5.8 feet early Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 4.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Deland 4.0 3.7 Thu 3 am 4.3 4.7 5.2 5.6 5.8 &&
